intro: Anchusa leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Anchusa leptophylla is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
